feed.title: Google Cloud: App Engine standard environment Python
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: App Engine standard environment Python

entry.content: Python 2.7 is deprecated. You won't be able to deploy Python 2.7 applications, even if your organization previously used an organization policy to re-enable deployments of legacy runtimes. Your existing Python 2.7 applications will continue to run and receive traffic. We recommend that you migrate to the latest supported version of Python.
entry.summary: The Python 2.7 runtime is now deprecated and deployments are no longer possible. While existing applications will continue to run, migration to a supported Python version is strongly recommended.
entry.title: Deprecated: Python 2.7 Runtime Deprecation

entry.summary: The Python 3.14 runtime for App Engine standard environment is now in General Availability. This update provides access to the latest Python features and improvements for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.14 Runtime Now Generally Available

entry.summary: The Python 3.14 runtime is now available in preview for App Engine standard environment.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.14 Runtime in Preview

entry.content: To improve email security and ensure reliable, high-volume email delivery, migrate from the legacy Mail API to an SMTP-based email service, such as SendGrid, Mailgun, or Mailjet (Preview).
entry.summary: We are moving to a new email service for better security and delivery.
entry.title: Feature: Email Delivery Update

entry.content: To increase security, starting in March 2025, support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1.1 and earlier is deprecated. Update your application settings in the App Engine standard environment to use TLS version 1.2 and later, along with a corresponding secure set of cipher suites (Preview).
entry.title: Feature: TLS 1.1 and earlier deprecated

entry.content: For new deployments, the URL Fetch API validates the certificate of the host it contacts by default.
entry.summary: The URL Fetch API now validates host certificates by default for new deployments, enhancing security for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: URL Fetch API Certificate Validation
